source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: DTT is proposed to enhance treatment efficacy for IBD.

source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: The efficacy and safety of DTT on Crohn's disease are explored.

source: Dual-targeted therapy (DTT) for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: The efficacy and safety of DTT on ulcerative colitis are explored.

source: Therapeutic Agents Targeting Cellular Signaling Pathways for IBD
description: These agents target signaling pathways related to IBD.

source: Therapeutic Agents Targeting Leukocyte Trafficking in IBD
description: These agents affect leukocyte movement involved in IBD.

source: JAK-dependent therapeutic agents for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: These agents act through the Janus kinase signaling pathway in IBD.

source: JAK-independent therapeutic agents for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
description: These agents do not rely on the Janus kinase pathway for their action in IBD.
